abstract: Wiener Schnitzel, apple strudel, the Prater, Schönbrunn, and the Danube? The Viennese are proud of the fact that in Austria's capital, even the sights are really worth seeing. Beyond the well-trodden paths, however, a completely unknown, kinky, even morbid Vienna can be found with less icing and dreams of waltzes and more living and dying (after all, the saying goes that Vienna is the most beautiful place in the world to die in).
title: 111 places in Vienna that you shouldn't miss

notes: 1492, An Ongoing Voyage describes both pre- and post-contact America, as well as the Mediterranean world. Sections are, What Came To Be Called America, The Mediterranean World, Christopher Columbus, Inventing America, Europe Claims America and Epilogue.
title: 1492: an ongoing voyage

other_titles: Fifteen days without a head
author: Cousins, Dave
notes: Accelerated Reader/Renaissance Learning UY 4 8 Quiz number: 221848
abstract: Fifteen-year-old Laurence Roach just wants a normal life, but it's not easy when your mum is a depressed alcoholic, and your six-year-old brother thinks he's a dog. When Mum fails to come home one night, Laurence tells nobody, terrified he and his brother will be taken into care if anyone finds out. Instead, he attempts to keep up the pretence that Mum is still around: dressing up in her clothes to trick the neighbours and spinning an increasingly complicated tangle of lies. After two weeks on their own, running out of food and money, and with suspicious adults closing in, Laurence finally discovers what happened to his mother. And that's when the trouble really starts ...A compelling thriller filled with some hilarious and surreal moments. Fifteen Days Without a Head is a tender, honest story about family, forgiveness and hope.
title: 15 days without a head

abstract: Congratulations! You now have a baby in your family. Follow our top tips and you'll all be very happy! Don't lend your baby to a kangaroo, plant your baby in the garden, or take to school with you - and definitely don't send your baby to play with an elephant! Do cuddle your baby, read to your baby, sing to your baby and give your baby lots and lots of love.
title: 15 things not to do with a baby

subjects: Great Britain - History - Revolution of 1688 - Social aspects
Great Britain - History - Revolution of 1688 - Historiography
notes: Formerly CIP. -Includes bibliographical references (p. [489]-617) and index. -The unmaking of a modern revolution -- Rethinking revolutions -- Going Dutch: the transformation of English society -- English politics at the accession of James II -- The ideology of Catholic modernity -- The practice of Catholic modernity -- Resistance to Catholic modernity -- Popular revolution -- Violent revolution -- Divisive revolution -- Revolution in foreign policy -- Revolution in political economy -- Revolution in the church -- Conclusion -- Assassination, association, and the consolidation of revolution -- Conclusion: the first modern revolution. -The Glorious Revolution of 1688-89 has been underestimated, argues Steve Pincus. Showing how it represented an ideological break with the past, & setting the revolution in a broad international context, Pincus assesses the impact of 1688 & claims it was the first truly 'modern' revolution.
abstract: The Glorious Revolution of 1688-89 has been underestimated, argues Steve Pincus. Showing how it represented an ideological break with the past, & setting the revolution in a broad international context, Pincus assesses the impact of 1688 & claims it was the first truly 'modern' revolution.
title: 1688 : the first modern revolution

notes: This website aims to show what life was like for a middle-class Victorian family in Victorian England in 1876. Topics include: home decoration, entertainment, etiquette, Christmas, shopping and weddings.
title: 1876 Victorian England revisited

notes: This site was created to accompany the PBS TV program featuring the Bowler family who have volunteered to live in the manner of a middle-class English family in 1900. Visitors to the site can view the rooms of the house, find out about the family and go behind the scenes. The site includes lesson plans and further resources.
title: The 1900 House

notes: Time's 1900 vs. Now site has topics such as world population, infant mortality, entertainment, world forests and the Olympics. Other sections include leaders and revolutionaries, artists and entertainers, scientists and thinkers, heroes and icons.
title: 1900 vs. now

notes: This website provides notes on the Russian Revolutions of 1905 and 1917. Topics include the causes, course and results of the 1905 Revolution and the causes of 1917 Revolution.
title: 1905 Russian Revolution

notes: This website for senior students has a precis of an article by John Morison in the History Review (December 2000) about the accumulation of grievances that led to the 1905 Russian Revolution. The website also includes a timeline, glossary, who's who, reading and questions.
title: 1905 Russian Revolution

notes: The National Library of Ireland has created this online exhibit about the 1916 Rising. It includes over 500 images drawn from the Library’s books, newspapers, drawings, and proclamations. The exhibit provides a basic outline of Irish history, and then moves through the events over the following centuries that would lead up to the Uprising itself. It focuses on those who set the stage for the events of Easter Week 1916, the seven signatories of the proclamation and whose who were executed.
title: 1916 rising: Personalities and perspectives

notes: Tyne and Wear Museums have a site that looks at life in the north east of Great Britain during the Great depression period of the1930s. It examines the family, 1930s life and the user can play a game of blow football. Suitable for interactive whiteboard.
title: 1930's family

notes: This website provides background information about events, trends, world leaders, entertainers and US sports figures of the 1950s.
title: 1950s

notes: Region 2, 1 disc(s), Disc format DVD 9 dual layer, Interactive menus, Ratio (1:1.85 (17.9) Theatrical widescreen), Enhanced for WideScreen TV, Languages (English, German, French, Spanish), Sound (Dolby Mono), Subtitles (French, Spanish, Dutch, Swedish, Finnish, Portuguese, Turkish), Subtitles for hard of hearing (English, German) ,. -Made in 1984. -Based on the novel by George Orwell. -Cast: John Hurt, Richard Burton, Cyril Cusack, Suzanna Hamilton, Gregory Fisher, James Walker, Andrew Wilde, David Trevena, Phyllis Logan. -Credits: cinematographer, Roger Deakins; costumes, Emma Porteous; executive producer, Martin J. Rosenblum; make up, Mary Hillman; music, Dominic Muldowney; special effects A/V, Ian Scoones. -In a holocaustic future world, perpetually at war, where failure to conform is the ultimate crime, Winston Smith (John Hurt) rewrites history books and finds himself dreaming of escape from the all-seeing eyes of the Authorities. He embarks on a passionate (and illegal) affair with a young woman (Suzanna Hamilton) but they are soon caught and Smith undergoes a nightmarish brainwashing at the hands of the chief inquisitor O'Brien (Richard Burton). -DVD.

This CyberGuide, from Schools of California Online Resources for Educators (SCORE) Project, has been developed as a unit of work for teaching George Orwell's novel 1984. Students are asked to consider the power of language and image, both as tools of oppression and liberation.
title: 1984 by George Orwell

notes: A BBC description of the June, 4th 1989 events in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, China. The article places the event in context and includes a video of the events.
title: 1989: Massacre in Tiananmen Square

notes: The South Asia, Kashmir or Northern Pakistan earthquake occurred on October 8, 2005 with the epicentre in the Pakistan-administered region of the disputed territory of Kashmir in South Asia. Topics include a description of the earthquake, casualties, damage, rescue and relief operations and the international response.
title: 2005 Kashmir earthquake

notes: A report on the human impact, physical causes and effects, casualties, damage, rescue and relief operations for the October, 2005 earthquake in Indian and Pakistan administered Kashmir.
title: 2005 Pakistan earthquake

notes: A BBC news feature report on the aftermath of the destruction caused by the October, 2005 earthquake in Indian and Pakistan administered Kashmir. The website includes background information, images and personal stories.
title: 2005: South Asia Quake

abstract: Bursting with amazing, action-packed photographs, this fantastic book includes a preview of the 2010 FIFA World Cup as well as profiles of all the the tournament's star players. In addition to Zakumi, the 2010 competition's official mascot, there are features on the tournament itself, fill-in progress charts and many fun puzzles and quizzes.
title: 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa Fact File
